text:
The New York Yankees and New York City Public Schools will host the 2025 Back-to-School Resource Fair for families and students of Bronx School District 9 on Friday, August 29 from 2:00 p.m. – 5:00 p.m. at Yankee Stadium. Media coverage instructions are at the end of this advisory.

The annual shared initiative is designed to ensure that local families have access to resources that will allow their children to excel throughout the 2025-2026 school year. Families attending the event will be provided with backpacks and school supplies, and more than 25 community organizations will be on hand to provide information about their services in the areas of food & accommodation, health & social services, youth initiatives and employment opportunities.

The mission of New York City Public Schools is to ensure that each student graduates on a pathway to a rewarding career and long-term economic security, equipped to be a positive force for change.

name: Colgate-Palmolive
title: Procter & Gamble's Innovation Playbook: Working or Wearing Thin? - Nasdaq
description:
However, the question looming over Procter & Gamble’s playbook is whether this constant push for innovation is still yielding enough incremental advantage to outpace competitors.
Image Source: Zacks Investment Research From a valuation standpoint, PG trades at a forward price-to-earnings ratio of 22.1X compared with the industry’s average of 19.9X.
Image Source: Zacks Investment Research The Zacks Consensus Estimate for PG’s fiscal 2025 and 2026 EPS indicates year-over-year growth of 2.3% and 6.3%, respectively.
Image Source: Zacks Investment Research Procter & Gamble currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).
Zacks Investment Research The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
text:
The Procter & Gamble Company PG has long been considered a powerhouse of consumer goods innovation, with a strategy built around “irresistible superiority” across product, packaging, brand communication and retail execution. In its latestearnings call management emphasized that this innovation engine continues to deliver results, from the success of Pampers in China to Swiffer’s record-breaking PowerMop launch and the promising debut of Tide evo, a plastic-free, water-free detergent format. These innovations illustrate the company’s ability to anticipate consumer needs, blend functionality with sustainability and leverage marketing in ways that both grow categories and reinforce brand equity.

However, the question looming over Procter & Gamble’s playbook is whether this constant push for innovation is still yielding enough incremental advantage to outpace competitors. As leadership acknowledged, some categories have lost their edge in “superiority,” leading to share pressures in North America despite heavy reinvestment in innovation. This dynamic highlights the delicate balance between breakthrough launches that fuel growth and the risk of incremental updates that fail to excite consumers or widen the competitive gap.

The company’s restructuring program, focusing on portfolio streamlining, supply chain optimization and organizational redesign, is intended to re-energize innovation and ensure resources are deployed against the most promising opportunities.

Procter & Gamble’s ability to sustain its innovation-driven model will be tested against a backdrop of slowing category growth, trade-down pressures and heightened competition. While the company boasts a strong pipeline of upcoming launches and an unmatched track record of placing products on Circana’s New Product Pacesetters list, investors are watching closely to see if these efforts translate into market outperformance or merely defend share.

PG’s Peers: How CHD & CL Approach Innovation Differently

Church & Dwight CHD and Colgate-Palmolive Company CL showcase contrasting innovation approaches, one rooted in trusted, value-driven extensions, the other in premium, science-backed advancements.

Church & Dwight has built its reputation on value-driven innovation, leaning heavily on trusted heritage brands like Arm & Hammer, Trojan and OxiClean. Its strategy often focuses on incremental product extensions, new formats, improved formulas, or expanded uses, that resonate with consumers seeking reliable, affordable solutions. This “small but steady” approach has worked well in household and personal care, where CHD consistently finds growth opportunities in overlooked niches.

Colgate’s innovation strategy is centered on premiumization and science-backed product superiority, particularly in oral care, where brands like Colgate Total, Optic White and elmex continue to anchor growth. The company is investing heavily in new formulations, advanced whitening technologies and gum-health solutions, while also pushing into sustainable packaging and premium pet nutrition with Hill’s Science Diet and Prescription Diet innovations.

PG’s Price Performance, Valuation & Estimates

Procter & Gamble’s shares have lost around 6.9% year to date compared with the industry’s 4.5% dip.

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

From a valuation standpoint, PG trades at a forward price-to-earnings ratio of 22.1X compared with the industry’s average of 19.9X.

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

The Zacks Consensus Estimate for PG’s fiscal 2025 and 2026 EPS indicates year-over-year growth of 2.3% and 6.3%, respectively. The company’s EPS estimates for fiscal 2025 and 2026 have moved downward in the past 30 days.

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Procter & Gamble currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here.

name: Agilent
title: Life sciences firm Agilent raises annual revenue outlook - MarketScreener
description:
(Reuters) -Agilent Technologies raised its annual revenue forecast on Wednesday after beating quarterly estimates, betting on improving demand for its medical tools and equipment used in lab research and drug development.
Life sciences firms, such as Agilent, have experienced weak order levels over the past two years stemming from reduced spending from biotech clients.
The company now expects an annual profit between $5.56 and $5.59 per share, compared to its previous forecast of $5.54 to $5.61 apiece.
It also expects fourth-quarter revenue to be in the range of $1.82 billion to $1.84 billion, compared to estimates of $1.77 billion.
The company's third-quarter revenue came in at $1.74 billion, beating estimates of $1.67 billion.
text:
(Reuters) -Agilent Technologies raised its annual revenue forecast on Wednesday after beating quarterly estimates, betting on improving demand for its medical tools and equipment used in lab research and drug development.

Life sciences firms, such as Agilent, have experienced weak order levels over the past two years stemming from reduced spending from biotech clients. However, contract research organizations have signaled steady demand from the industry for tools and services that are used in the development of novel medicines.

Agilent sees revenue to be between $6.91 billion and $6.93 billion for the year, compared to its prior outlook range of $6.73 billion to $6.81 billion. This is above the analysts' average estimate of $6.79 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG.

The company now expects an annual profit between $5.56 and $5.59 per share, compared to its previous forecast of $5.54 to $5.61 apiece. Analysts expect a profit of $5.58 per share.

It also expects fourth-quarter revenue to be in the range of $1.82 billion to $1.84 billion, compared to estimates of $1.77 billion.

It sees a profit between $1.57 and $1.60 per share for the fourth quarter, compared to estimates of $1.60 per share.

The company's third-quarter revenue came in at $1.74 billion, beating estimates of $1.67 billion.

Sales in its life sciences and diagnostics segment were at $670 million, beating the estimate of $641.5 million, while revenue from its CrossLab unit, which offers products and services for laboratory management, came in at $744 million, above estimates of $718.27 million.

Its adjusted profit for the quarter ended July 31 was $1.37 per share, in line with estimates.

(Reporting by Bageshri Banerjee and Sriparna Roy in Bengaluru; Editing by Alan Barona)

name: Ecolab
title: How A Direct-To-Chip Liquid Cooling Solution Can Reduce Energy Usage In Data Center Operations
authors: John Knowles, Ecolab John Knowles, Studio B
description:
One solution is direct-to-chip liquid cooling, which brings cooling power directly to the heat source, or server chips, via an integrated loop of piping that circulates coolant through the servers.
Ecolab, a global leader in water, hygiene and infection prevention solutions, is focused on data center liquid cooling.
The system provides real-time monitoring of coolant health and other parameters to help data centers maintain efficient and reliable performance.
The company's recent direct-to-chip liquid cooling innovation helps data centers respond to changing operations as they address rising demand for water and energy resources.
With this offering and others for cooling water and adiabatic applications, Ecolab can support the entire data center cooling landscape from site to chip.
text:
Data centers have become a critical part of daily life. With the advent of artificial intelligence, machine learning and other high-performance computing, or HPC, applications, it’s estimated that global demand for data center capacity could rise at an annual rate of between 19% and 22% from 2023 to 2030 to reach an annual demand of 171 to 219 gigawatts.

As the pressure placed on data center providers increases and facilities grow to accommodate heavier computing loads, their heat load will grow along with them. HPC applications require advanced chips that use more power and generate more heat than traditional servers. This means data center operators will need to find new, more effective ways to manage cooling.

One solution is direct-to-chip liquid cooling, which brings cooling power directly to the heat source, or server chips, via an integrated loop of piping that circulates coolant through the servers.

Ecolab, a global leader in water, hygiene and infection prevention solutions, is focused on data center liquid cooling. To protect servers and cooling infrastructure, the company has developed 3D TRASAR technology for direct-to-chip applications. The system provides real-time monitoring of coolant health and other parameters to help data centers maintain efficient and reliable performance.

Ecolab Senior Corporate Account Manager Matt McMullen said that 3D TRASAR monitoring technology has been around for more than two decades, with more than 50,000 systems implemented at customer locations. The company's recent direct-to-chip liquid cooling innovation helps data centers respond to changing operations as they address rising demand for water and energy resources.

3D TRASAR technology uses smart sensors to allow for remote monitoring and reporting to help a variety of cooling operations run efficiently. With this offering and others for cooling water and adiabatic applications, Ecolab can support the entire data center cooling landscape from site to chip.

”We’re leveraging our industry experience across other critical loops to create a best practice around real-time monitoring and control,” McMullen said. “Our approach ultimately helps maximize cooling, optimize water usage and extend the life cycle of critical equipment for data center operators.”

McMullen continued to reflect that data center demand is expected to rise four times its current capacity in the next five years, and it's bringing a lot of stress to its infrastructure. 3D TRASAR technology helps alleviate this burden, particularly through smart water management resources in the data center.

McMullen described smart water management as a holistic approach that looks at a data center’s available water sources and takes into account climate versus cooling options, local regulation and water consumption during power generation.

“Our company looks at all of these factors to determine the best way to leverage the existing water and find out how to leverage it for reduced energy consumption and reliable cooling,” he said.

Data centers require significant power to operate, and newer cooling systems are not only expensive to run but can be even more costly when they go down. McMullen said that finding the best practice for maximizing coolant health and heat transfer efficiencies can minimize the energy needed for cooling and help reduce downtime.

“By reducing the power use or maintaining lower power use, we can extend the life of the coolant and limit data center downtime,” he said. “Changing a coolant in a critical space is difficult, and we want to avoid a disruption in the data center such as overheating or potential equipment failure.”

3D TRASAR has already created a positive impact for data centers, particularly through its ability to connect to Water Quality IQ performance insights for cooling water. In 2024, Ecolab collaborated with data center service provider Digital Realty to use AI-driven insights in 35 of Digital Realty’s U.S. facilities for its water-cooling operations.

“Our platform helped focus on a variety of Digital Realty sites to address water-related optimization opportunities,” McMullen said. “When fully implemented, we believe the solution will help avoid the withdrawal of up to 126 million gallons of potable water from local watersheds annually.”

McMullen said that more data center companies need to think about smart cooling early in the design phase, particularly evaporative cooling. One example is adiabatic cooling. Adiabatic cooling uses the natural process of water evaporation to cool air, reducing the need for mechanical cooling systems like chillers, which lowers operational costs and reduces power usage.

3D TRASAR is available to monitor adiabatic cooling activity as well. McMullen said this will be more widespread for operations over the next 10 years.

“There's a saying in the industry: The most sustainable data center is the one you didn't build,” McMullen said. “To get more out of each data center, it starts with the design phase and the idea of smart water and evaporative cooling to help lower your PUE.”

McMullen said he believes a smart water management approach will be adopted even more as data center operators look to non-potable water sources to cool their facilities and reduce environmental impact.

“Like many industries, data centers can leverage reclaimed water while still prioritizing reliable, high-performing operations,” McMullen said. “At Ecolab, we’re not only looking at recycling multiple types of water sources, like rainwater, gray water and black water, but also helping our customers do this in a more sustainable and cost-effective way.”

This article was produced in collaboration between Ecolab and Studio B. Bisnow news staff was not involved in the production of this content.

MU YTD mountain Micron Technology stock in 2025.

"Rising spending on AI infrastructure globally is propelling demand for HBM.
text: Micron Technology could have a bright growth runway ahead, thanks to the artificial intelligence boom, according to CLSA. The investment firm began research coverage of the computer memory and data storage stock with an outperform rating and a $155 per share price target in a Wednesday report, implying about 33% upside from Tuesday's $116.50 close. Analyst Sanjeev Rana said Micron is "riding the crest of the AI wave" thanks to customers' strong appetite for high bandwidth memory and dynamic random access memory, or DRAM. MU YTD mountain Micron Technology stock in 2025. "Micron is well-positioned to capitalize on the demand for high bandwidth memory (HBM) from AI customers and to benefit from the healthy demand-supply balance in DRAM in 2H25-2026," the analyst said. "The supply of conventional DRAM will remain constrained due to suppliers' focus on HBM." "Rising spending on AI infrastructure globally is propelling demand for HBM. Micron's faster-than-expected ramp-up of HBM3E 12-Hi in 2025 and its supply to four major customers underscores its robust technological prowess and flawless execution," the analyst added. Micron shares have already surged nearly 40% in 2025.

description:
Barclays raised its price target on Sempra Energy to $80 from $71 and maintained an Equal Weight rating on the shares.
Barclays has upgraded its price target for Sempra Energy (SRE) to $80 from $71, while maintaining an 'Equal-Weight' rating on the shares.
The upgrade in the price target comes amidst mixed analyst ratings.
The overall consensus among analysts suggests a target price of $83.61, with a high estimate of $91.00 and a low estimate of $76.43 [1].
Overall, the upgrade in the price target by Barclays underscores the positive sentiment surrounding Sempra Energy's growth prospects and strong financial performance.
text:
Barclays raised its price target on Sempra Energy to $80 from $71 and maintained an Equal Weight rating on the shares. The firm's decision was based on the company's strong financial performance and strategic growth initiatives. The new target suggests a potential upside of around 15% from the current share price.

Barclays has upgraded its price target for Sempra Energy (SRE) to $80 from $71, while maintaining an 'Equal-Weight' rating on the shares. This move reflects the analyst's positive outlook on Sempra's strong financial performance and strategic growth initiatives. The new target implies a potential upside of approximately 15% from the current share price of $71.00 [1].

Sempra Energy, a major utility company, serves a significant customer base in the United States, distributing natural gas and electricity in Southern California and owning a substantial stake in Oncor, a Texas-based transmission and distribution business. The company's recent financial results have been robust, with analysts forecasting an earnings per share (EPS) of $4.76 for the current year, up from the previous year's $0.89 [2].

The upgrade in the price target comes amidst mixed analyst ratings. While Barclays has raised its target, BMO Capital Markets has also increased its target to $81.00, reflecting a consensus rating of "Moderate Buy" [2]. The overall consensus among analysts suggests a target price of $83.61, with a high estimate of $91.00 and a low estimate of $76.43 [1].

Sempra Energy's strategic initiatives, including its investments in infrastructure and renewable energy projects, have bolstered its financial prospects. The company's focus on sustainable energy solutions and its strong market position in the utility sector are key drivers for the positive outlook [2].

Institutional investors have also shown interest in Sempra Energy, with Raymond James Financial Inc. reducing its holdings by 3.6% in the first quarter but still retaining a significant stake valued at approximately $96.9 million [2]. Other institutional investors, such as Mattson Financial Services LLC and Opal Wealth Advisors LLC, have also increased their stakes in the company [2].

Overall, the upgrade in the price target by Barclays underscores the positive sentiment surrounding Sempra Energy's growth prospects and strong financial performance. Investors should closely monitor the company's future earnings and strategic initiatives to gauge the potential for further upside in the stock price.

name: H&M
title: German Drug Commissioner highlights government concerns over medical, non ... - StratCann
description:
The Commissioner takes specific exception with how Germans currently can access medical cannabis online, and highlights concerns with the country’s cultivation laws for non-medical cannabis.
Germany first allowed the prescribing of cannabis flowers for medical purposes by physicians in 2017.
That’s why I am in favor of no longer prescribing cannabis flowers.” Cannabis from Canada supplies much of the German medical market.
A distant third was Denmark, exporting 2,282 kg of cannabis to Germany’s medical cannabis program in Q2 2025.
Bloomwell Group, a Frankfurt-based medical cannabis company, recently released new data and a map showing the distribution of medical cannabis patients across Germany, highlighting areas with the most and least patients.
text:
Germany’s Commissioner of Drug and Addiction Policy says he wants to tighten the country’s cannabis regulations.

In a recent interview, Hendrik Streeck, appointed Commissioner on April 28, 2025, provided further insight into the new government’s thoughts on a multi-stage evaluation of Germany’s cannabis regulations, which is currently underway.

The first results from that evaluation are expected this fall, with additional findings to follow in the spring.

The Commissioner takes specific exception with how Germans currently can access medical cannabis online, and highlights concerns with the country’s cultivation laws for non-medical cannabis.

“We’ll have to look at some figures, such as the development of the black market, traffic accident statistics, the number of users, but also whether there’s an increase in cannabis-induced psychoses,” Streeck told the Rheinische Post, a prominent German regional daily newspaper, in an interview published on August 27.

While the Commissioner told the publication that it was too early to respond to specific policy questions regarding issues like home cultivation, cultivation clubs—which are currently allowed—and the possibility of sales through pharmacies, he did say that growing three plants at home is “far too much for personal use.”

“That’s an enormous amount. A knowledgeable owner with a green thumb can harvest about a kilo of cannabis with it,” Streeck told the publication, saying there is a clear need to reform Germany’s cannabis laws.

A joint document from the country’s recently elected coalition government said earlier this year that there would be “an open-ended evaluation of the law on the legalization of cannabis” in the fall, which was already planned as part of the original legislation.

Although the previous German government had created several new avenues for accessing cannabis for medical and non-medical purposes, the recently elected Conservative government (CDU) has said that it does not support easier access to cannabis, seeking to roll back a recent surge in Germans using cannabis under the medical program.

According to one analyst, it’s estimated that approximately between 700,000 and 900,000 individuals in Germany are accessing medical cannabis through pharmacies.

A new bill in Germany seeks to restrict how people access medical cannabis, rolling back rules that have allowed online consultations and mail order delivery from pharmacies. The bill seeks to restrict how people can access cannabis for medical purposes, requiring in-person authorizations for cannabis, as well as in-person sales (the Bill can be viewed here, translated). The move could significantly impact the country’s medical cannabis imports.

Germany first allowed the prescribing of cannabis flowers for medical purposes by physicians in 2017. The country then legalized recreational, non-medical cannabis in March 2024. The law came into effect in two phases.

The first phase, which allowed for personal cannabis cultivation and possession, came into force on April 1, 2024, and cultivation clubs were allowed in July. More than 100 of these clubs have already been approved.

The second phase was intended to facilitate regional model projects with commercial supply chains; however, shifting domestic politics appears to have slowed down that process.

“The law must definitely be more stringent and coherent,” the new Commissioner of the Federal Government for Drug and Addiction Policy told the Rheinische Post. “It isn’t at the moment. For everything else, we’ll have to wait and see what the evaluation reveals. There are no restrictions on thinking here.

“The situation is different with medicinal cannabis. Medicinal cannabis is currently being abused too often for recreational use. Health Minister Warken has already proposed a change in the law, which I welcome. It cannot be that online pharmacies deliberately direct people through medical forms in order to immediately obtain private prescriptions for medicinal cannabis. As a doctor, all the alarm bells are going off for me here. Imagine that with other medications. We also need to make adjustments with regard to medicinal cannabis.”

While the Commissioner seems to support some forms of cannabis for medical purposes, he takes exception with cannabis flower and the way flower is traditionally consumed.

“While capsules and drops have a constant active ingredient content, the THC content of flowers fluctuates considerably depending on the plant and harvest. This is precisely the problem: Sales of cannabis flowers have increased by 80 percent—​​a clear indication that this is less about alleviating illness than about consumption.

“Flowers are usually smoked, damage the lungs, and increase the risk of cancer. For the treatment of pain or epilepsy, capsules and drops are the medically sensible form – precisely dosed, evidence-based, and safe. Current developments show that many have simply switched from the black market to a legal loophole. This is an abuse of medical regulations. We have a proven system in Germany: doctors make diagnoses, prescribe medications in clear dosages, and pharmacies dispense them in a controlled manner. This principle must also apply to cannabis. That’s why I am in favor of no longer prescribing cannabis flowers.”

Cannabis from Canada supplies much of the German medical market. In the second quarter of 2025, Germany imported 43,257 kg of cannabis for medical purposes, with nearly half (20,107 kg) coming from Canada, an increase from the 16,057 kg imported from Canada in Q1 2025.

Portugal exported the second-highest amount of cannabis into Germany in the same period, with 13,465 kg. Portugal often acts as an intermediary between countries like Canada and Germany, thereby adding to Canada’s overall exports to the European Union’s most populous country.

A distant third was Denmark, exporting 2,282 kg of cannabis to Germany’s medical cannabis program in Q2 2025.

Bloomwell Group, a Frankfurt-based medical cannabis company, recently released new data and a map showing the distribution of medical cannabis patients across Germany, highlighting areas with the most and least patients.

A ban on accessing cannabis online and through the mail could affect about half of all registered patients in Germany, argues the company, driving many of these medical consumers back into the illicit market.

There are three licensed medical cannabis producers in Germany. Two companies, Tilray and Aurora, are based in Canada, while a German company, Demecan, is the third.

name: Publicis Groupe
title: Dentsu Performance marks 4 years of growth and innovation - Bizcommunity
authors: BizCommunity, Saul Marquez, Karabo Ledwaba, Bizcommunity.com, The Rooms Network, Melissa Steele, Cape Town Tourism, Roula Inglesi-Lotz, Jessika Bohlmann, Tracy Kitchen
description:
What began as a small collective has developed into a performance-driven, technology-enabled practice that dentsu describes as “running at full speed” in the digital marketing space.
Over the past four years, Dentsu Performance has added a suite of new capabilities, including retail digital media, performance creative, AI-powered measurement and reporting, and generative SEO.
According to the agency, its growth has been powered not only by technical innovation but also by building trust with partners and cultivating a high-energy internal culture.
Dentsu Performance has collected accolades at the Loeries, Bookmarks, Assegai, and Pitcher Awards, underlining its ability to deliver creative and performance-led campaigns at scale.
From expanding our client portfolio to delivering standout results across the board, our growth has been powered by a team that’s as ambitious as it is collaborative.
text:
Founded with a team of just over 60 digital specialists, the unit now numbers more than 70, having grown its remit and sharpened its offering in response to client needs and market shifts. What began as a small collective has developed into a performance-driven, technology-enabled practice that dentsu describes as “running at full speed” in the digital marketing space.

Over the past four years, Dentsu Performance has added a suite of new capabilities, including retail digital media, performance creative, AI-powered measurement and reporting, and generative SEO. The team also launched Salesnet, its proprietary digital private marketplace, and achieved Google Marketing Platform Sales Partner status, signalling its strengthening expertise in martech integration and data-driven solutions.

This expansion has been underpinned by a clear focus on client relationships. According to the agency, its growth has been powered not only by technical innovation but also by building trust with partners and cultivating a high-energy internal culture.

The results have not gone unnoticed. Dentsu Performance has collected accolades at the Loeries, Bookmarks, Assegai, and Pitcher Awards, underlining its ability to deliver creative and performance-led campaigns at scale.

Reflecting on the milestone, Sadiqah Levy, group performance director, said: “Four years in, and the momentum hasn’t slowed. From expanding our client portfolio to delivering standout results across the board, our growth has been powered by a team that’s as ambitious as it is collaborative. I’m proud of what we’ve built, and even more excited for what’s next.”

name: Instacart
title: Whole Foods will transition to Amazon labor framework in December - Supermarket News
description:
Amazon is shifting its Whole Foods employees to Amazon’s compensation and benefits systems beginning in December, according to reports.
The transition follows the company’s unification of its global grocery operations under Jason Buechel, the CEO of Whole Foods, earlier this year.
In addition to operating more than 535 Whole Foods retail stores, Amazon also owns and operates the Amazon Fresh grocery chain, a handful of Amazon Go store locations, and its grocery ecommerce business.
Whole Foods corporate staff will also no longer be able to work remotely four weeks per year, the report said.
Workers at Whole Foods stores and other facilities will continue to receive a 20% discount at Whole Foods.
text:
Amazon is shifting its Whole Foods employees to Amazon’s compensation and benefits systems beginning in December, according to reports.

Corporate staff will be offered new employment with Amazon on Nov. 10 and will be given about a month to review the new offers, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

The transition follows the company’s unification of its global grocery operations under Jason Buechel, the CEO of Whole Foods, earlier this year. In addition to operating more than 535 Whole Foods retail stores, Amazon also owns and operates the Amazon Fresh grocery chain, a handful of Amazon Go store locations, and its grocery ecommerce business.

“As shared with employees in June, Whole Foods Market corporate employees will move to the same programs and offerings as the rest of Amazon corporate employees, including compensation structure and benefits, creating one consistent experience across teams,” Lauren Snyder, an Amazon spokesperson, told Supermarket News. “We’re excited to bring our grocery teams closer together to make it even easier to collaborate and innovate on behalf of our customers.”

Amazon previously said it had been duplicating some of its efforts in grocery and missing out on opportunities to drive efficiency when Whole Foods and Amazon Fresh were operating independently.

No more Whole Foods discount for corporate workers

Current Whole Foods corporate workers, including employees in such roles as marketing and merchandising, will be offered new titles, salaries, and benefits, according to the Wall Street Journal report. They will continue to receive a discount at Whole Foods until December of next year. Whole Foods corporate staff will also no longer be able to work remotely four weeks per year, the report said.

Corporate employees will receive a 10% discount on Amazon.com, worth up to $100 a year, effective this December, the company said. Workers at Whole Foods stores and other facilities will continue to receive a 20% discount at Whole Foods.

The changes come as Walmart has recently expanded the discount available to its employees, allowing them to receive 10% off on all food products all year. The discount previously had been limited to certain items, with broader discounts available during the year-end holiday season.

Amazon expands its grocery operations

The consolidation of Amazon’s grocery operations also comes as the company adds more services, including same-day perishables delivery in more than 1,000 cities and towns across the U.S., with plans to expand to 1,300 additional locations by year-end.

In addition, Andy Jassy, Amazon’s CEO, said in a recent Q&A with investors that he was “very bullish” on the company’s grocery business. He said Whole Foods was growing “meaningfully faster than the grocery industry in general,” with strong profitability metrics.

He also said the new, small-format Whole Foods Daily Shop stores that have opened during the past year in New York City have outperformed expectations, and additional locations are planned.

name: J&J
title: 13 Toxic Boss Types — and How to Avoid Becoming One: Work Strategist - Business Insider
description:
"Bad bosses aren't born bad.
Bad bosses are made," Mallick, who worked at Unilever until 2020, told Business Insider.
The book outlines 13 bad boss archetypes — from the micromanager to the credit thief, the chaos agent to the fearmonger.
The grinner This boss, Mallick said, was beloved, kind, cheerful, always smiling.
"Bad bosses steal it."
text:
You might think you're a good boss — supportive, fair, and hardworking. But what if you're the reason your team dreads Monday?

That's the uncomfortable question former Unilever and Johnson & Johnson marketing executive Mita Mallick asks in her forthcoming book, "The Devil Emails at Midnight: What Good Leaders Can Learn from Bad Bosses."

"Bad bosses aren't born bad. Bad bosses are made," Mallick, who worked at Unilever until 2020, told Business Insider.

The title nods to one of her first bosses, a manager whose communication style was to send barrages of emails at midnight. Spoiler alert: that's probably not a great idea.

The book outlines 13 bad boss archetypes — from the micromanager to the credit thief, the chaos agent to the fearmonger. All, Mallick argues, can be changed if leaders are willing to be honest with themselves.

1. The devil who emails at midnight

During a summer internship, Mallick's boss barely interacted with her in person. Instead, she sent midnight email barrages with urgent tasks and no context. Mallick started replying out of fear.

Mallick said she had just two 15-minute meetings with her across an entire 11-week internship.

She recommends auditing your calendar to make space for your team during business hours. If you work late, use scheduled send — and be clear that responses can wait until morning.

2. The boss who gives unwanted nicknames

This manager renamed Mallick "Mohammed" because her real name, Madhumita, was "too hard." Others joined in. Mallick eventually quit.

She advises learning and using people's names correctly and fostering team norms that call out microaggressions early. Don't make colleagues do the emotional labor of explaining why it hurt.

3. The napper

This boss routinely slept in meetings, delegated everything, and gossiped about how much he hated his job. He was actively disengaged, yet inexplicably tolerated by leadership.

Mallick says leaders should be proactive about disengagement, whether it's their own or someone else's. Her "be a mirror" framework involves giving feedback, creating space for honesty, and building an improvement plan with clear accountability.

4. The chopper

This boss insisted on being cc'd on every email, nitpicked minor formatting, and constantly redid her team's work, even when it didn't need redoing.

Related stories

Business Insider tells the innovative stories you want to know

Business Insider tells the innovative stories you want to know

Mallick warns micromanagement erodes trust. Instead, she recommends focusing on outcomes, coaching through mistakes, and resisting the urge to hover. Ask yourself: Is this about quality or control?

5. The white rabbit

This boss turned every task into a crisis. Urgent huddles, moving deadlines, and panic-driven chaos became the norm.

Mallick recommends defining urgency explicitly. Her framework — Define, Prioritize, Protect — helps leaders keep focus and avoid burning out their teams with fake fire drills.

6. 'Medusa'

This boss screamed at staff, berated people for salad orders, and once hurled a designer shoe at a colleague.

"Fear kills communication, trust, and innovation," Mallick writes. She urges leaders to stop equating intensity with authority and instead create safe spaces where people feel heard and respected.

7. The great pretender

After Mallick announced her pregnancy, she described how this manager reassigned her projects, denied her opportunities, and sent constant "quick asks" while she was on leave — all while promoting herself as an ally to working moms.

She advises asking team members what they need — don't assume. "Protective" behaviors rooted in bias often sideline ambitious employees.

8. The grinner

This boss, Mallick said, was beloved, kind, cheerful, always smiling. But he was utterly incompetent, per Mallick.

He had no idea what to do on the job and outsourced everything to his team.

Mallick stresses that kindness isn't a substitute for competence. If you're in over your head, ask for help, get trained, or reconsider whether managing people is right for you.

9. The cheerleader

This boss was relentlessly positive and used that positivity to deny reality. He ignored challenges and set impossible goals, then blamed the team when they missed them.

Mallick recommends replacing "toxic positivity" with grounded optimism. Validate struggles. Don't ask people to smile through setbacks — support them through solutions.

10. 'Gossip Girl'

Mallic said this boss shared confidential information, spread rumors about team members, and used gossip to maintain power.

Mallick was eventually accused of saying something she hadn't, and nearly lost a key workplace friendship over it.

"Just don't engage," she advises. Set norms that shut gossip down and build a culture of transparency where people feel seen without backchanneling.

11. The spotlight stealer

This manager plagiarized teamwork, lifted Mallick's entire self-review, and asked her to email his boss with fabricated praise.

She advises letting people present their own work. "Good leaders share the spotlight," she writes. "Bad bosses steal it."

12. 'Tony Soprano'

When Mallick explored internal opportunities, her boss accused her of betrayal. He called her a "rat," tried to block her transfer, and forced her to quit to escape him.

"You don't own your team," she writes. Leaders must support growth, not punish ambition. Let people go when they're ready to grow.

13. The grieving boss

Mallick's most personal story: after her father died, she became inconsistent, emotionally distant, and reactive — everything she had warned others about.

She said that when a team member quit, it was a wake-up call.

She recommends being honest when you're not OK. Take time off. Set expectations. Grief doesn't excuse bad leadership, but ignoring it can create more harm.

text:

This optimistic outlook aligns with the company's recent financial performance and strategic initiatives. nCino is a prominent player in the financial technology sector, providing cloud-based banking solutions to financial institutions. name: BNY Mellon
title: The Federal Reserve has been criticized by Trump, and gold may emerge as the biggest winner.
description:
If the market believes that the Federal Reserve is setting policy based on direct political influence, U.S. assets will lose their appeal."
Flanagan noted that once Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell resumes interest rate cuts in September as expected, the issue of the Fed's independence may "become irrelevant."
Some believe that the Federal Reserve has never truly been free from government politics.
Stefan Gleason, President and CEO of Money Metals, stated that the independence of the Federal Reserve is a "myth."
Chris Gannatti, Head of Global Research at WisdomTree, remarked that "if the Federal Reserve loses its independence, gold will become the preferred safe-haven asset for investors."
text:
U.S. President Trump has taken action to dismiss a member of the Federal Reserve Board, a move that could undermine confidence in the U.S. dollar and U.S. Treasury bonds, while enhancing the appeal of gold and other assets regarded as safe havens.

James St. Aubin of Ocean Park Asset Management stated, "The independence of the Federal Reserve is its hallmark, and the act of dismissing a board member is a direct attack on its ability to formulate monetary policy free from political motivation. When you begin to weaken confidence in the monetary policy of a global reserve currency, you are playing with fire. If the market believes that the Federal Reserve is setting policy based on direct political influence, U.S. assets will lose their appeal."

On Monday evening, Trump announced the immediate dismissal of Cook on 'Truth Social,' attempting to shake the credibility of the central bank. However, his legal authority to do so is being questioned.

Robert Savage, Managing Director and Head of Market Strategy and Insights at Bank of New York Mellon, stated that the dismissal of Cook represents "a historic test of presidential power in the United States." In an email, he noted that a loss of trust in the Federal Reserve's independence would pose long-term risks to U.S. bonds and the dollar, thereby limiting investors' safe-haven options.

On Tuesday, the yield on the 30-year U.S. Treasury bond rose slightly (bond yields move inversely to prices), while the U.S. dollar index fell slightly.

Savage stated that the market's reaction to Cook's dismissal is "temporarily muted due to legal proceedings," expecting this process to last for several months. The importance of Federal Reserve independence lies in the historical concerns over government intervention in interest rate cuts to promote pro-cyclical policies, which has been a driver of inflation exceeding 2%. He added, "The risk of a bubble bursting increases, leading to shorter business cycles."

In the long run, inflation exceeding 2% also comes at a cost, Savage pointed out, "This manifests as a reduction in fixed income duration holdings, thereby limiting long-term business investment."

Controversies and Market Games Surrounding the Independence of the Federal Reserve

Kevin Flanagan, Head of Income Strategy at WisdomTree, stated that if the independence of the Federal Reserve is ultimately called into question, it could have a "negative impact on the back end of the U.S. Treasury yield curve... but we are not at that point yet." In the short term, the market's focus is on the upcoming employment and inflation data, as well as the September Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting.

Flanagan noted that once Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell resumes interest rate cuts in September as expected, the issue of the Fed's independence may "become irrelevant."

Some believe that the Federal Reserve has never truly been free from government politics. Stefan Gleason, President and CEO of Money Metals, stated that the independence of the Federal Reserve is a "myth."

He pointed out that the Federal Reserve is "essentially a political institution, not only because the Board is appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate, but also because our entire monetary system today has a political nature. We no longer have a sound currency backed by gold; rather, we have a political currency that is centrally planned by policymakers through monetary policy adjustments."

The Rise of Alternative Assets

However, once trust in the Federal Reserve fractures, the risks associated with the dollar and U.S. Treasuries increase, inflation rises, and investors will rush to seek alternative assets. Savage from Bank of New York Mellon stated that traditionally, investors hedge against high inflation through physical assets, including gold, oil, and industrial metals.

Gold may top the list of candidates. Chris Gannatti, Head of Global Research at WisdomTree, remarked that "if the Federal Reserve loses its independence, gold will become the preferred safe-haven asset for investors." The company believes that any threat to the Fed's independence serves as a "powerful catalyst for gold demand."

"Gold does not have counterparty risk, does not rely on government credibility, and has a historical record of thousands of years as the ultimate store of value," said Ganatti. "During periods of political or monetary uncertainty, it is the most trusted asset for investors to preserve value." Data from 2025 supports this, with Ganatti noting that global central banks are expected to purchase approximately 1,000 tons of gold this year, marking a fourth consecutive year of significant accumulation.

Savage from the Bank of New York Mellon stated that "investing internationally in countries with stable growth and low inflation" also helps hedge against high inflation in the United States. Thus, commodities and international investments "are clear alternative choices for current investors."

The situation regarding cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin as alternative assets is more complex, as they play an important role in emerging markets with depreciating fiat currencies. Savage noted, "They also involve payment systems and the growing demand for banking services in frontier markets."

Overall, Jim Masturzo, Chief Investment Officer of Multi-Asset Strategies at Research Affiliates, indicated that when the risk of financial assets rises (such as when the Federal Reserve loses its independence), physical assets like gold and real estate will become safe havens.

"Investors have enjoyed substantial returns from the U.S. stock and bond markets over the past 15 years," he remarked. "Regardless of the risks to the Federal Reserve's independence, U.S. stock valuations are nearing historic highs, making it a good time to take profits and focus on other safe-haven assets."

AinvestWednesday, Aug 27, 2025 3:51 am ET 1min read Moody's ratings affirms Air Liquide's A2 rating: outlook stable Moody's Investors Service has affirmed Air Liquide's long-term issuer rating at A2 with a stable outlook.
Moody's highlights Air Liquide's ability to navigate the volatile industrial gas market, driven by its strategic investments and operational efficiency.
The deal is part of Air Liquide's strategy to expand its footprint and tap into South Korea's high-tech sectors, including semiconductors, clean energy, and mobility.
Air Liquide's CEO, François Jackow, commented on the acquisition, stating that it aligns with the company's commitment to profitable long-term growth.
This strategic move is expected to contribute to Air Liquide's net profit growth within one year of integration.
text:
AinvestWednesday, Aug 27, 2025 3:51 am ET

1min read

Moody's ratings affirms Air Liquide's A2 rating: outlook stable

Moody's Investors Service has affirmed Air Liquide's long-term issuer rating at A2 with a stable outlook. The rating reflects the company's strong balance sheet, consistent cash flow generation, and robust market position in the industrial gases sector. Moody's highlights Air Liquide's ability to navigate the volatile industrial gas market, driven by its strategic investments and operational efficiency.

The latest rating affirmation comes amidst Air Liquide's significant expansion in South Korea, where the company has signed a binding agreement to acquire DIG Airgas for €2.85 billion [1]. This acquisition, expected to close in the first semester of 2026, will strengthen Air Liquide's market position in the sixth-largest manufacturing country by GDP and the fourth-largest industrial gas market [2]. The deal is part of Air Liquide's strategy to expand its footprint and tap into South Korea's high-tech sectors, including semiconductors, clean energy, and mobility.

Air Liquide's CEO, François Jackow, commented on the acquisition, stating that it aligns with the company's commitment to profitable long-term growth. The acquisition will enable Air Liquide to build a reference player in South Korea, leveraging DIG Airgas's strong operational assets and backlog of nearly 20 secured projects [2]. This strategic move is expected to contribute to Air Liquide's net profit growth within one year of integration.

From a financial perspective, the transaction values DIG Airgas at a 2024 EBITDA multiple of 20.2, reducing to 14.8 when factoring in secured project backlogs and cost synergies [2]. Air Liquide plans to finance the deal initially through a structured bridge loan, later refinanced via bond issuance.

The acquisition not only strengthens Air Liquide's leadership in Asia and the global electronics sector but also underlines its long-term dedication to South Korea's economic growth and clean energy transition [2]. Moody's expects Air Liquide to continue its growth trajectory, driven by its strong financial standing and global footprint.

References:

[1] https://www.indianchemicalnews.com/gas/air-liquide-to-acquire-south-korean-dig-airgas-for-285-billion-27216

[2] https://www.chemanalyst.com/NewsAndDeals/NewsDetails/air-liquide-signs-agreement-to-acquire-dig-airgas-a-major-gas-company-38763

title: CVS settles with Massachusetts for $12.25 million over MassHealth pricing - Investing.com
description:
Investing.com -- Pharmacy has agreed to pay $12.25 million to settle allegations that it overcharged Massachusetts’ Medicaid program by not offering the same discounted prices available to cash-paying customers.
Massachusetts Attorney General Andrea Joy Campbell announced the settlement on Wednesday, resolving claims that CVS charged MassHealth higher prices than those offered to the general public for identical medications.
"When pharmacies overcharge MassHealth, they’re undermining the integrity of our public programs and leaving taxpayers to foot the bill," said AG Campbell.
The settlement stems from an April 2025 lawsuit alleging CVS offered lower drug prices to cash-paying customers through a discount program run by ScriptSave while failing to report and bill MassHealth at these lower rates.
Customers with these ScriptSave discount cards often received lower prices than those charged to MassHealth.
text:
Investing.com -- Pharmacy has agreed to pay $12.25 million to settle allegations that it overcharged Massachusetts’ Medicaid program by not offering the same discounted prices available to cash-paying customers.

Massachusetts Attorney General Andrea Joy Campbell announced the settlement on Wednesday, resolving claims that CVS charged MassHealth higher prices than those offered to the general public for identical medications.

"When pharmacies overcharge MassHealth, they’re undermining the integrity of our public programs and leaving taxpayers to foot the bill," said AG Campbell.

The settlement stems from an April 2025 lawsuit alleging CVS offered lower drug prices to cash-paying customers through a discount program run by ScriptSave while failing to report and bill MassHealth at these lower rates.

According to the complaint, CVS violated Massachusetts’ "Most Favored Nation" drug pricing regulation, which has been in effect since 1995 and requires pharmacies to charge MassHealth the lowest price offered to any other customer.

The Attorney General’s office claimed CVS contracted with ScriptSave to administer discount card programs for former customers of CVS’s Health Savings Pass program and former Target pharmacies acquired by CVS. Customers with these ScriptSave discount cards often received lower prices than those charged to MassHealth.

Beyond the financial payment, CVS will implement a yearly reconciliation process to review prescription drug pricing for MassHealth members, ensuring the program isn’t overcharged in the future.

This article was generated with the support of AI and reviewed by an editor. For more information see our T&C.

name: Philips
title: Philips Releases Transcend Plus Providing Image Quality Advancements and Other Enhancements
description:
Transcend Plus delivers major advancements in image quality and artificial intelligence (AI), including newly FDA-cleared 2D and 3D image quality enhancements and a growing suite of AI-enabled clinical applications — all designed to meet the growing challenges of cardiac care.
With increased patient volume, rising clinical complexity and persistent staffing shortages, Transcend Plus is designed to help cardiology teams by offering fast, reproducible results with uncompromising image quality and decision-making support.
FDA-cleared AI Applications, Now Fully Integrated Philips now offers 26 FDA-cleared cardiovascular ultrasound AI applications — the most in the industry — fully integrated into Transcend Plus for both EPIQ and Affiniti CVx systems.
Among the latest enhancements to receive FDA 510(k) clearance are 2D Auto EF and 2D Auto EF Advanced.
The 2D Auto EF feature enables accurate assessments even when contrast agents cannot be used, such as in patients with renal impairment.
text:
Aug. 27, 2025 — Royal Philips has released Transcend Plus, the next generation of its EPIQ CVx and Affiniti CVx cardiovascular ultrasound systems. Transcend Plus delivers major advancements in image quality and artificial intelligence (AI), including newly FDA-cleared 2D and 3D image quality enhancements and a growing suite of AI-enabled clinical applications — all designed to meet the growing challenges of cardiac care. With increased patient volume, rising clinical complexity and persistent staffing shortages, Transcend Plus is designed to help cardiology teams by offering fast, reproducible results with uncompromising image quality and decision-making support.

"Transcend Plus represents a bold leap forward in the evolution of echocardiography, reinforcing our commitment to continuous innovation, empowering clinicians with AI-driven tools that enhance confidence, accelerate decision-making, and elevate care at every stage of the cardiac journey,” said David Handler, Business Leader, Cardiology Ultrasound at Philips. “Transcend Plus is more than an advancement – it’s a clear statement of Philips’ leadership in cardiovascular ultrasound. Building on the momentum of our original Transcend launch, Transcend Plus brings the full power of AI integration to the forefront, giving clinicians the confidence, speed, and precision they need to lead in cardiac care – today and into the future.”

Enhanced Image Quality

Transcend Plus visibly improves sharpness, contrast and detail in 2D and 3D imaging, featuring the latest FDA-cleared enhancements for EPIQ CVx and Affiniti CVx. These upgrades support superior visualization of cardiac anatomy and function, enabling diagnostic confidence even in the most complex or technically challenging cases. The update also introduces the new 2D Auto EF Advanced feature, expanding AI capabilities for contrast images – essential for accurately assessing cardiac function.

“Artificial intelligence is a tool, not a threat, and I always maintain that human plus AI is going to be better than human alone or AI alone – the 3D Auto CFQ and 3D Auto TV AI applications are examples of this, taking manual, time-consuming processes and automating these measurements in a fast, easy and reproducible way,” said Akhil Narang, MD, Director, Echocardiography Laboratory and Associate Professor of Medicine, Division of Cardiology at the Feinberg School of Medicine, Northwestern University and Bluhm Cardiovascular Institute.

FDA-cleared AI Applications, Now Fully Integrated

Philips now offers 26 FDA-cleared cardiovascular ultrasound AI applications — the most in the industry — fully integrated into Transcend Plus for both EPIQ and Affiniti CVx systems. Among the latest enhancements to receive FDA 510(k) clearance are 2D Auto EF and 2D Auto EF Advanced. These advanced tools are designed to streamline clinical workflows and improve diagnostic accuracy across a range of care settings, from the echo lab through the hospital to outpatient clinics, pre-assessment, and long-term follow-up. With these integrated AI applications, clinicians can assess patients more quickly, consistently, and confidently across the entire care continuum.

Left Ventricular Function Assessment

Left ventricular (LV) function assessment is one of the most critical applications in cardiac imaging, playing a central role in diagnosing and managing a wide range of cardiac conditions. Transcend Plus directly supports this need by delivering fast, reproducible results that help cardiologists quickly and definitively evaluate LV function consistently across different patients and over time. Automated tools minimize operator variability, ensuring more reliable and standardized measurements, especially vital in high-volume or high-pressure clinical environments. In addition, Transcend Plus offers robust support for both contrast and non-contrast imaging. The 2D Auto EF feature enables accurate assessments even when contrast agents cannot be used, such as in patients with renal impairment. Building on this, 2D Auto EF Advanced adds AI-powered quantification capabilities for both contrast and non-contrast studies, broadening clinical applicability and enhancing measurement reliability in patients with poor image quality or challenging acoustic windows. These capabilities combine to deliver a more confident, efficient approach to cardiac care.

Clinical Confidence

Transcend Plus empowers clinicians to make fast, confident decisions across every cardiac care setting – whether in the echo lab, interventional suite, or during routine outpatient assessments. By delivering sharper imaging and intelligent automation, it enables more informed care, streamlines workflows, and helps providers manage growing patient volumes without compromising diagnostic quality or clinician well-being. Transcend Plus delivers three core benefits: enhanced image quality for clearer visualization of cardiac anatomy and improved diagnostic precision; advanced AI integration, with 26 FDA-cleared applications that automate and accelerate routine tasks; and faster, more actionable insights that reduce delays and support timely, evidence-based clinical decisions throughout the care journey.

Transcend Plus will be demonstrated live at the European Society of Cardiology 2025 Congress in Madrid and the American Society of Echocardiography meeting in Nashville.

name: Instacart
title: Amazon spokesperson: Whole Foods Market corporate employees will move to the same ... - AInvest
description:
Effective December 8, 2025, Whole Foods corporate employees will transition to Amazon's systems and programs.
Additionally, Whole Foods employees will receive Amazon stock as part of their compensation package instead of an annual bonus.
Amazon spokesperson Lauren Snyder emphasized that the move is designed to bring the grocery teams closer together, fostering better collaboration and innovation.
Whole Foods employees have expressed concerns about the cultural shift, but Amazon maintains that the integration is essential for driving collaboration and innovation.
After the transition, in-store discounts will be reserved for Whole Foods in-store employees, starting in 2027.
text:
In a significant move to align its grocery business with the parent company, Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) has announced that it will offer its Whole Foods corporate employees new positions with benefits and perks similar to those of other Amazon employees. This integration, set to begin next year, is part of Amazon's broader effort to streamline its operations and enhance collaboration and innovation within its grocery division.

Effective December 8, 2025, Whole Foods corporate employees will transition to Amazon's systems and programs. This shift includes replacing Whole Foods' unique benefits, such as in-store discounts and four weeks of remote work per year, with Amazon's standard offerings. Additionally, Whole Foods employees will receive Amazon stock as part of their compensation package instead of an annual bonus.

Amazon spokesperson Lauren Snyder emphasized that the move is designed to bring the grocery teams closer together, fostering better collaboration and innovation. The integration comes as Amazon ramps up its in-house grocery business to compete with rivals like Walmart (WMT), Instacart (CART), and Kroger (KR) with same-day delivery of fresh groceries.

The announcement has had a mixed impact on the market. While Amazon's shares have risen, the news has also weighed on competitors' shares. This integration marks a continuation of Amazon's strategy to centralize Whole Foods' operations and scale back some of its distinctive perks and benefits since its acquisition in 2017.

Whole Foods employees have expressed concerns about the cultural shift, but Amazon maintains that the integration is essential for driving collaboration and innovation. After the transition, in-store discounts will be reserved for Whole Foods in-store employees, starting in 2027.

References:

[1] https://seekingalpha.com/news/4489581-amazon-offering-whole-foods-corporate-employees-new-positions---report

name: ArcelorMittal
title: Brazil's Marinho comments in 'worst case scenario for tariffs' - AInvest
description:
AinvestWednesday, Aug 27, 2025 1:56 pm ET 2min read Brazil's Marinho comments in ‘worst case scenario for tariffs’ Brazil's steel industry is facing an uncertain future as the expiration of key trade protections and escalating geopolitical tensions loom large.
The U.S. tariffs, framed as politically motivated, have strained bilateral relations and raised questions about the durability of trade protections.
Analysts speculate that the tariffs could be reversed before August 1, 2025, given Brazil's trade deficit with the U.S. and its lack of competitive threat in the steel sector.
If the Brazilian government extends tariffs and strengthens import controls, ArcelorMittal's domestic market share could grow, enhancing its EBITDA contribution [1].
The resolution of the U.S. tariffs will be a critical inflection point.
text:
AinvestWednesday, Aug 27, 2025 1:56 pm ET

2min read

Brazil's Marinho comments in ‘worst case scenario for tariffs’

Brazil's steel industry is facing an uncertain future as the expiration of key trade protections and escalating geopolitical tensions loom large. ArcelorMittal, the world's largest steel producer, has been navigating these challenges with its $25 billion investment in Brazil, which includes a significant expansion of its Tubarão plant. The company's strategic decisions are closely tied to the political landscape and trade policies.

According to a recent statement by ArcelorMittal's Brazil head, Jorge Oliveira, the company's expansion plans for the Tubarão plant could be delayed or canceled if the Brazilian government does not extend current trade protections by May 2025. The expiration of these protections, along with the ongoing U.S. tariffs, poses a significant risk to ArcelorMittal's investment pipeline and the 1.2 million jobs it supports in Brazil's construction and automotive sectors [1].

The U.S. has imposed a 50% tariff on Brazilian steel, disrupting ArcelorMittal's export strategy and forcing it to redirect shipments to European plants and accelerate U.S. production. While the U.S. later exempted Brazilian pig iron from the tariff, the broader trade war has had a substantial impact on ArcelorMittal's operations and financial performance. The company has already incurred financial losses of $150 million in 2025 due to these tariffs [1].

Brazil's political landscape adds another layer of risk. The U.S. tariffs, framed as politically motivated, have strained bilateral relations and raised questions about the durability of trade protections. Analysts speculate that the tariffs could be reversed before August 1, 2025, given Brazil's trade deficit with the U.S. and its lack of competitive threat in the steel sector. However, the Brazilian government's response remains unpredictable [1].

Investors are closely monitoring the situation. The risks for investors are clear: if trade policies remain unstable, ArcelorMittal's $25 billion investment could yield subpar returns. Additionally, rising interest rates in Brazil, projected to hit 14.75%, threaten to dampen demand in the automotive sector, a key client for ArcelorMittal [1].

Yet, the opportunities are equally compelling. A successful expansion in Brazil would solidify ArcelorMittal's position as a global steel leader. The company's recent acquisition of Nippon Steel's stake in the Calvert joint venture and the launch of a new electric arc furnace in Alabama demonstrate its agility in navigating trade barriers. If the Brazilian government extends tariffs and strengthens import controls, ArcelorMittal's domestic market share could grow, enhancing its EBITDA contribution [1].

For investors, the key is to monitor trade policy developments in Brazil and the U.S. ArcelorMittal's ability to pivot, such as its U.S. production expansion, mitigates some risks. However, long-term success depends on political stability. The resolution of the U.S. tariffs will be a critical inflection point. A reversal could unlock $200 million in annual savings for ArcelorMittal, while a prolonged trade war could force further cost-sharing with customers [1].

References:

[1] https://www.ainvest.com/news/arcelormittal-brazil-gambit-navigating-tariffs-imports-political-uncertainty-25-billion-bet-2508/

[2] https://www.wsj.com/business/retail/j-m-smucker-posts-loss-as-tariffs-raise-coffee-prices-84230c31

name: Levi Strauss
title: Abercrombie Q2 Earnings Top Estimates, Hollister Brand Up 19% - Nasdaq
description:
Abercrombie’s earnings per share (EPS) of $2.32 in the fiscal second quarter declined 7.2% from $2.50 in the year-ago quarter.
The top-line beat was driven by broad-based net sales growth across regions and exceptional growth at its Hollister brand.
The Abercrombie brand contributed 45.7% to the total company sales, whereas Hollister contributed 54.3% to sales.
Our model predicted sales growth of 2.2% for the Abercrombie brand and 6.1% for Hollister.
For fiscal 2025, Abercrombie plans 60 store openings, together with 40 remodels and rightsizes, and 20 closures.
text:
Abercrombie & Fitch Co. ANF posted second-quarter fiscal 2025 results, wherein the top and bottom lines beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate. Additionally, on a year-over-year basis, the company’s top line increased, but the bottom line declined.

Abercrombie’s earnings per share (EPS) of $2.32 in the fiscal second quarter declined 7.2% from $2.50 in the year-ago quarter. However, the bottom line beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $2.27.

Abercrombie & Fitch Company Price, Consensus and EPS Surprise

Abercrombie & Fitch Company price-consensus-eps-surprise-chart | Abercrombie & Fitch Company Quote

Net sales of $1.21 billion advanced 7% year over year on a reported basis and 6% on a constant-currency basis. The top line surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $1.19 billion. ANF’s comparable sales (comps) improved 3%. The top-line beat was driven by broad-based net sales growth across regions and exceptional growth at its Hollister brand.

Abercrombie & Fitch delivered another quarter of record results, marking its eleventh straight period of growth. Performance was led by Hollister, which achieved its strongest-ever second quarter, reflecting strong back-to-school and summer demand. Abercrombie brands faced a modest decline against exceptionally strong growth last year. The company improved profitability, supported by disciplined inventory management and strategic promotions, while also returning capital to its shareholders through ongoing share repurchases. Looking ahead, Abercrombie raised its full-year outlook, citing strong momentum and continued confidence in its global brands.

Shares of this Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) company have lost 11.3% in the past three months against the industry's 0.6% growth.

ANF Stock's Price Performance

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Abercrombie’s Regional & Brand Sales Drive Growth

Sales in the Americas increased 8% year over year to $974.2 million, EMEA sales fell 1% to $197.2 million and APAC sales gained 12% to $37.1 million. Comps rose 5% in the Americas, fell 5% in EMEA and were up 1% in APAC regions.

Net sales fell 5% year over year to $551.9 million for the Abercrombie brand. Moreover, sales increased 19% to $656.7 million at Hollister. The Abercrombie brand contributed 45.7% to the total company sales, whereas Hollister contributed 54.3% to sales. Comps fell 11% for Abercrombie and grew 19% for Hollister in the quarter.

Our model predicted sales growth of 2.2% for the Abercrombie brand and 6.1% for Hollister. We estimated sales to increase 4% in the Americas, 3.4% in EMEA and 9.5% in APAC.

ANF’s Quarterly Performance: Margins & Expenses

Abercrombie’s gross margin of 62.6% in the fiscal second quarter contracted 230 basis points (bps) year over year.

Selling expenses were $375.4 million, which fell 1.9% year over year. As a percentage of sales, selling expenses contracted 260 bps to 31.1%. General and administrative costs fell 1.6% to $175.3 million, while the metric, as a percentage of sales, decreased 120 bps to 14.5%.

The company reported an operating income of $206.7 million, up 17.7% from $175.6 million in the year-ago period. It registered an operating margin of 17.1%, up 160 bps from 15.5% in the year-ago quarter.

ANF’s Financial Health Looks Stable

Abercrombie ended the fiscal second quarter with cash and cash equivalents of $572.7 million, no net long-term borrowings and stockholders’ equity of $1.3 billion, excluding non-controlling interests.

The company had a liquidity of $1 billion at the end of the fiscal second quarter, which included cash and equivalents. Net cash provided by operating activities was $113 million as of Aug. 2, 2025.

In the second quarter of 2025, the company repurchased about 0.6 million shares for roughly $50 million. Year to date through Aug. 2, 2025, a total of 3.2 million shares were bought back for $250 million, reducing shares outstanding by 7% before the effect of stock compensation vesting. ANF still has $1.05 billion available under the repurchase program authorized in March 2025.

Abercrombie’s Q3 & FY25 Outlook

Abercrombie & Fitch increases its full-year net sales outlook, with profitability updated to reflect the current $90 million estimated tariff cost impact. For the third quarter of fiscal 2025, net sales are projected to rise 5-7% from the $1.21 billion recorded in the year-ago period. The operating margin for the quarter is expected to be 11-12%. It expects EPS to be in the band of $2.05-$2.25, lower than the $2.50 reported in the year-ago quarter. The effective tax rate is expected to be about 31%. The outlook incorporates share repurchases of at least $50 million and diluted weighted average shares of around 48 million.

For fiscal 2025, the company expects year-over-year sales growth in the range of 5-7% compared with 3-6% growth expected earlier. This upside is likely to be backed by growth across regions and brands. ANF anticipates an operating margin in the band of 13-13.5%, up from the previous guidance of 12.5-13.5%.

For fiscal 2025, management envisions weighted average shares of around $49 million, which reflects the impacts of 2025 share repurchases of $400 million. Combined with the tax rate, ANF predicts EPS to be in the bracket of $10-$10.50 compared with the $9.5-$10.40 guided earlier.

Abercrombie anticipates an effective tax rate of around 30% for fiscal 2025. Capital expenditure is estimated to be $225 million for the current fiscal year.

For fiscal 2025, Abercrombie plans 60 store openings, together with 40 remodels and rightsizes, and 20 closures.

Key Picks

Some top-ranked stocks are Levi Strauss & Co. LEVI, Wolverine World Wide, Inc. WWW and Torrid Holdings CURV.

Levi designs and markets jeans, casual wear and related accessories for men, women and children. It flaunts a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) at present. You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.

The Zacks Consensus Estimate for Levi’s current fiscal-year earnings indicates growth of 4% from the year-ago actual. LEVI delivered a trailing four-quarter average earnings surprise of 25.9%.

Wolverine is engaged in the designing, manufacturing and distribution of a wide variety of casual as well as active apparel and footwear. It currently sports a Zacks Rank of 1.

The Zacks Consensus Estimate for Wolverine’s current financial-year earnings and sales indicates growth of 43.9% and 6.2%, respectively, from the year-ago actuals. WWW delivered a trailing four-quarter average earnings surprise of 39.1%.

Torrid Holdings currently carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). The Zacks Consensus Estimate for Torrid Holdings’ 2025 sales and EPS indicates a decrease of 5.6% and 6.7%, respectively, from the year-ago period’s levels. CURV delivered a trailing negative four-quarter average earnings surprise of 10.5%.

Beyond Nvidia: AI's Second Wave Is Here

The AI revolution has already minted millionaires. But the stocks everyone knows about aren't likely to keep delivering the biggest profits. Little-known AI firms tackling the world's biggest problems may be more lucrative in the coming months and years.

name: Albertsons
title: Ohio-based grocery stores cutting nearly 1000 jobs after announcing 60 store closures
description:
In an effort to simplify operations, a grocery store headquartered in Cincinnati announced Tuesday that they’re cutting nearly 1,000 jobs.
According to Grocery Dive, an internal company memo from Kroger’s CEO Ron Sargent said these reductions are part of structural changes to its administrative teams across the U.S., aiming to simplify Kroger and refocus priorities.
This latest round of job cuts marks the third round of layoffs at Kroger in just eight months.
This indicates, “The company is working to rebound following its failed merger attempt with Albertsons,” said Grocery Dive.
