name: U.S. Bank
title: Ugreen releases new Qi2.2 certified power bank in more countries - Notebookcheck
authors: Polly Allcock, a young age, I have loved gadgets
description:
Ugreen has released the MagFlow 25W Magnetic Power Bank in more countries.
This Qi2.2-certified accessory was unveiled earlier in 2025 and has since been released in several European countries.
Now, the Ugreen MagFlow Qi2 25W Magnetic Power Bank is also available in the US.
The power bank has also reached Amazon in the UK, where it is priced at £79.99.
Ugreen’s MagFlow 25W Magnetic Power Bank can charge three devices simultaneously.
text:
Ugreen has released the MagFlow 25W Magnetic Power Bank in more countries. This Qi2.2-certified accessory was unveiled earlier in 2025 and has since been released in several European countries.

Now, the Ugreen MagFlow Qi2 25W Magnetic Power Bank is also available in the US. At Amazon, it is priced at $89.99, but it only costs $69.99 at the moment when you buy it from the brand’s online store. However, purchases made directly from the company will ship from September 5th, while Amazon customers will have their orders filled immediately. The power bank has also reached Amazon in the UK, where it is priced at £79.99.

Ugreen’s MagFlow 25W Magnetic Power Bank can charge three devices simultaneously. There is an integrated braided USB-C cable and a USB-C port, each offering up to 30W power when used alone. Plus, at the front of the accessory is a Qi2.2 wireless charging pad for an up to 25W output. The company suggests that you could use this to change an iPhone 16 Pro Max to 50% in 30 minutes. There is also support for fast charging standards like PD 3.0, QC 4.0 and PPS.

name: Air Liquide
title: NASD Bourse Gains 0.25% - Business Post Nigeria
description:
By Adedapo Adesanya The NASD Over-the-Counter (OTC) Securities Exchange fell by 0.15 per cent on Tuesday, August 23 after two price losers overpowered five price gainers.
Meanwhile, Nigeria’s external reserves could rise to about $45 billion by the end of the year, according to market analysts.
With the reserves position strengthening, the CBN will have greater flexibility to sustain its interventionist approach in the FX market.
As for the cryptocurrency market, it grew during the session as traders jumped back in after Monday’s sell-off.
Analysts warn of overheated sentiment ahead of Friday’s PCE inflation data, a key signal for the US Federal Reserve next move.
text:
By Adedapo Adesanya

The NASD Over-the-Counter (OTC) Securities Exchange rose by 0.25 per cent on Monday, August 22, spurring the market capitalisation growing by N6.84 billion to N2.184 trillion from the N2.177 trillion quoted at the preceding session, as the NASD Unlisted Security Index (NSI) went up by 9.16 points to 3,649.10 points from 3,639.94 points last Friday.

During the trading day, the volume of securities dropped 78.8 per cent to 4.6 million units from the previous 21.6 million units, the value of transactions slumped by 40.6 per cent to N12.1 million from N20.3 million, and the number of deals jumped by 23.1 per cent to 49 deals from 20 deals.

When the market finished for the day, Okitipupa Plc was the most traded stock by value on a year-to-date basis with 158.7 million units worth N5.9 billion, followed by Air Liquide Plc with 507.2 million units transacted for N4.2 billion, and FrieslandCampina Wamco Nigeria Plc with 44.2 million units valued at N1.9 billion.

Also, Industrial and General Insurance (IGI) Plc was the most traded stock by volume on a year-to-date basis with 1.2 billion units sold for N402.9 million, trailed by Impresit Bakolori Plc with 536.9 million units worth N524.8 million, and Air Liquide Plc with 507.2 million units valued at N4.2 billion.

Yesterday, there were four gainers against three losers at the session.

The gainers were led by Food Concepts Plc, owners of Chicken Republic fast food outlet, after its price increased by 25 Kobo to N3.79 per share from N3.54 per share, UBN Property Plc expanded by 19 Kobo to N2.09 per unit from N1.90 per unit, IPWA Plc added 5 Kobo to close at 55 Kobo per share versus 50 Kobo per share, and IGI Plc went up by 2 Kobo to 60 Kobo per unit from the previous 58 Kobo per unit.

On the flip side, Afriland Properties Pc dipped by N1.15 to N19.85 per share from N21.00 per share, FrieslandCampina Wamco Nigeria Plc depreciated by 47 Kobo to N67.53 per unit from N68.00 per unit, and NASD Plc lost 5 Kobo to finish at N29.45 per share versus N29.50 per share.

By Aduragbemi Omiyale

A leading maker and distributor of industrial and medical gases, Industrial and Medical Gases (IMG) Plc, has commenced a rights issue aimed at raising funds for its expansion plans.

The company, listed on the Nigerian Exchange (NGX) Limited, also intends to use proceeds from the exercise to offset its current loan obligation.

IMG Plc plans to get about N6.4 billion from the rights issued expected to close on Thursday, October 2, 2025, according to details of the transaction.

It is offering for pick up a total of 199,797,458 ordinary shares at a unit price of N32.00, amounting to N6.394 billion.

It would be offered to shareholders on the basis of two new ordinary shares for every five ordinary shares held as of the close of business on Wednesday, May 21, 2025.

The rights issue commenced on Friday, August 22, 2025, and all the shares issued under this exercise will rank pari passu in all respects with the issued ordinary shares of the company.

IMG Plc has more than 60 years of experience in Nigeria. Its business involves a broad product portfolio which includes industrial gases (oxygen, nitrogen, argon, carbon dioxide, hydrogen, specialty calibration mixtures), medical gases (critical care oxygen, nitrous oxide, medical air and other life-support gases), food grade and refrigerant gases, alongside welding products and hard goods such as gas equipment regulators.

It also provides safety and risk assessment services to help mitigate hazards associated with pressurized gases.

The organisation delivers a comprehensive range of services for gas projects ranging from supply chain and product distribution support, engineering and general maintenance services. The firm leverages a network of three strategically located production plants across Lagos, Port Harcourt and Kaduna to deliver high quality gas products and allied services across Nigeria’s key industrial and healthcare hub.

By Adedapo Adesanya

The NASD Over-the-Counter (OTC) Securities Exchange fell by 0.15 per cent on Tuesday, August 23 after two price losers overpowered five price gainers.

This brought down the market capitalisation of the bourse by N4.38 billion to N2.179 trillion from the N2.184 trillion it ended at the preceding session, as the NASD Unlisted Security Index (NSI) declined by 5.65 points to 3,643.45 points from the 3,649.10 points it closed on Monday.

According to data, Central Securities Clearing System (CSCS) Plc depreciated by N1.20 to close at N47.00 per share versus N48.20 per share and UBN Property Plc lost 6 Kobo to end at N2.03 per unit, in contrast to the preceding day’s N2.09 per unit.

On the flip side, Lagos Building Investment Company (LBIC) Plc gained 27 Kobo to end at N3.35 per share compared with the preceding session’s N3.08 per share, Afriland Properties Plc increased by 10 Kobo to close at N19.95 per unit versus N19.85 per unit, Food Concepts Plc rose by 6 Kobo to N3.85 per share from N3.79 per share, Acorn Petroleum Plc expanded by 2 Kobo to end at N1.32 per unit versus N1.30 per unit, and Industrial and General Insurance (IGI) Plc appreciated by 1 Kobo to 61 Kobo share from 60 Kobo per share.

During the trading session, the volume of securities traded went up by 57.1 per cent to 7.2 million units from 4.6 million units, and the value of securities went down by 29.8 per cent to N8.5 million from N12.1 million, while the number of deals closed flat at 49 deals.

Okitipupa Plc retained its position as the most traded stock by value on a year-to-date basis with 158.7 million units transacted for N5.9 billion, followed by Air Liquide Plc with 507.2 million units worth N4.2 billion, and FrieslandCampina Wamco Nigeria Plc with 44.2 million units valued at N1.9 billion.

Also, IGI Plc maintained its spot as the most traded stock by volume on a year-to-date basis with 1.2 billion units worth N402.9 million, trailed by Impresit Bakolori Plc with 536.9 million units sold for N524.8 million, and Air Liquide Plc with 507.2 million units valued at N4.2 billion.

By Adedapo Adesanya

The Naira came under foreign exchange (FX) pressure on Tuesday, August 26, as its value further weakened against the US Dollar in the Nigerian Autonomous Foreign Exchange Market (NAFEM) at the close of transactions.

According to data obtained from the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), the Nigerian currency lost N1.11 or 0.07 per cent against the greenback yesterday to sell for N1,537.61/$1, in contrast to the N1,536.51/$1 it was traded on Monday.

However, the domestic currency appreciated against the Pound Sterling in the official market during the session by N1.47 to close at N2,074.24/£1 compared with the previous day’s N2,075.71/£1 and gained N4.45 against the Euro to close at N1,793.17/€1 versus Monday’s closing price of N1,797.62/€1.

In the parallel market, the Nigerian Naira depreciated against the Dollar yesterday by N2 to trade at N1,547/$1 compared with the preceding session’s rate of N1,545/$1.

There has been a rising demand for the US Dollar by eligible corporate FX users seeking foreign payments, pushing the central bank to inject FX into the system.

AIICO Capital Limited, in a note, said the interbank NFEM saw increased FX demand against a limited supply.

Meanwhile, Nigeria’s external reserves could rise to about $45 billion by the end of the year, according to market analysts. According to Cowry Assets Management, the momentum of reserve growth appears likely to continue, supported by steady offshore inflows and potential external borrowings planned by the government.

But, this is hinged on global risk conditions remaining broadly supportive and offshore flows not significantly disrupted. With the reserves position strengthening, the CBN will have greater flexibility to sustain its interventionist approach in the FX market.

As for the cryptocurrency market, it grew during the session as traders jumped back in after Monday’s sell-off. Traders seized lower prices as an opportunity to re-enter the market.

Analysts warn of overheated sentiment ahead of Friday’s PCE inflation data, a key signal for the US Federal Reserve next move.

Also, investors and traders remain widely optimistic due to expectations of monetary easing and increased institutional demand, with Solana (SOL) expanding by 7.4 per cent to $203.06.

Dogecoin (DOGE) appreciated by 4.5 per cent to $0.2205, Ethereum (ETH) rose by 3.7 per cent to $4,594.36, Cardano (ADA) increased by 2.9 per cent to $0.8642, Ripple (XRP) grew by 2.8 per cent to $3.00, Litecoin (LTC) jumped by 2.2 per cent to $113.48, Binance Coin (BNB) soared by 1.6 per cent to $859.24, and Bitcoin (BTC) advanced by 0.9 per cent to $111,273.21, while the US Dollar Tether (USDT) and the US Dollar Coin (USDC) closed flat at $1.00 each.

name: New York Public Library
title: TOFT Initiative Will Allow NYC Classrooms to Screen 4000+ Broadway Recordings
description:
Did you know that the New York Public Library for the Performing Arts holds a treasure trove of watchable theatre in its Theatre on and Tape (TOFT) archive?
Over 4,000 recordings of live theatrical performances and over 3,000 other titles are accessible to view at the Library to any theater professional, student, or researcher.
Now, according to a recent NYPL blog, the archive is now opening up to eligible New York City schools.
Learn more about the TOFT in Schools Initiative and watch as they captured The Outsiders on Broadway earlier this summer.
Since 1970, the Theatre on Film and Tape Archive (TOFT) has preserved live theatrical productions and documented the creative contributions of distinguished artists and legendary figures of the theatre.
text:
Did you know that the New York Public Library for the Performing Arts holds a treasure trove of watchable theatre in its Theatre on and Tape (TOFT) archive? Over 4,000 recordings of live theatrical performances and over 3,000 other titles are accessible to view at the Library to any theater professional, student, or researcher.

Now, according to a recent NYPL blog, the archive is now opening up to eligible New York City schools. It reads: "Is your school in rehearsals for a production? Are you studying a play in your English class? Are you learning about a period of history and want to help make it come alive for your students? If you said yes to any of these, then you are welcome to reach out to us to bring a video recording to your classroom."

Learn more about the TOFT in Schools Initiative and watch as they captured The Outsiders on Broadway earlier this summer.

Since 1970, the Theatre on Film and Tape Archive (TOFT) has preserved live theatrical productions and documented the creative contributions of distinguished artists and legendary figures of the theatre. With the consent and cooperation of the theatrical unions and each production's artistic collaborators, TOFT produces video recordings of Broadway, Off-Broadway, and regional theatre productions, as well as dialogues between notable theatre personalities. Learn more about how to access the archive.

Photo Credit: Jennifer Broski

name: Parker-Hannifin
title: Wesco Announces September Leadership Succession for EES Unit
description:
Electrical supplies distributor Wesco appointed Daniel Castillo as Executive Vice President and General Manager of the company’s Electrical & Electronic Solutions (EES) unit.
The EES unit comprised 38.3% of revenue during Wesco’s April-June quarter — essentially tied with Wesco’s Communications & Security Solutions CSS unit as the company’s largest.
Wesco reported total 2Q sales of $2.25 billion for its EES unit, up 6.0% year-over-year.
MDM Case Study: Wesco (Premium access here) “Danny is joining Wesco and assuming leadership of our EES business at an opportune time,” Wesco Chairman, President and CEO John Engel said in an Aug. 25 news release.
“As we recently reported, EES sales increased 6% year-over-year in the second quarter led by strong performance in OEM and Construction, along with a return to growth in Industrial.
text:
Electrical supplies distributor Wesco appointed Daniel Castillo as Executive Vice President and General Manager of the company’s Electrical & Electronic Solutions (EES) unit.

Effective Sept. 1, Castillo will lead the unit, succeeding Nelson Squires, who retires Sept. 30.

Castillo was previously EVP and President of North America at Brinks, overseeing secure solutions in the U.S., Canada and Mexico. Earlier roles include president of Cree Lighting, senior positions at JELD-WEN, Eaton and Cooper Industries, and the start of his career at General Electric.

The EES unit comprised 38.3% of revenue during Wesco’s April-June quarter — essentially tied with Wesco’s Communications & Security Solutions CSS unit as the company’s largest. Wesco reported total 2Q sales of $2.25 billion for its EES unit, up 6.0% year-over-year. Meanwhile, organic sales were likewise up 6.0% year-over-year. Adjusted EBITDA of $183 million declined 4.0% year-over-year, while margin of 8.1% increased 80 basis points year-over-year.

MDM Case Study: Wesco (Premium access here)

“Danny is joining Wesco and assuming leadership of our EES business at an opportune time,” Wesco Chairman, President and CEO John Engel said in an Aug. 25 news release. “As we recently reported, EES sales increased 6% year-over-year in the second quarter led by strong performance in OEM and Construction, along with a return to growth in Industrial. Our improving business momentum in EES is being driven by increased sales tied to data center and infrastructure projects across the U.S. and Canada. EES is beginning to see benefits from the secular growth trends of electrification, AI-driven data centers, automation and IoT and reshoring to North America.”

Squires has been with Wesco since 2015, moving from Canada and International Group VP & General Manager (2015-2019), to Chief Operating Officer (2019-2020) and to EES head since July 2020. He previously was a 27-year veteran at Air Products.

text:
L’Oreal (OTCMKTS:LRLCY – Get Free Report) and Kenvue (NYSE:KVUE – Get Free Report) are both large-cap consumer staples companies, but which is the superior business? We will compare the two businesses based on the strength of their analyst recommendations, earnings, dividends, risk, institutional ownership, profitability and valuation.

Get L'Oreal alerts:

Dividends

L’Oreal pays an annual dividend of $1.13 per share and has a dividend yield of 1.2%. Kenvue pays an annual dividend of $0.83 per share and has a dividend yield of 3.9%. Kenvue pays out 112.2% of its earnings in the form of a dividend, suggesting it may not have sufficient earnings to cover its dividend payment in the future. Kenvue has increased its dividend for 1 consecutive years. Kenvue is clearly the better dividend stock, given its higher yield and longer track record of dividend growth.

Institutional & Insider Ownership

0.4% of L’Oreal shares are held by institutional investors. Comparatively, 97.6% of Kenvue shares are held by institutional investors. 0.2% of Kenvue shares are held by insiders. Strong institutional ownership is an indication that hedge funds, endowments and large money managers believe a company will outperform the market over the long term.

Risk and Volatility

L’Oreal has a beta of 0.92, indicating that its stock price is 8% less volatile than the S&P 500. Comparatively, Kenvue has a beta of 0.83, indicating that its stock price is 17% less volatile than the S&P 500.

Analyst Recommendations

This is a breakdown of current ratings and price targets for L’Oreal and Kenvue, as reported by MarketBeat.com.

Kenvue has a consensus target price of $24.3750, indicating a potential upside of 15.03%. Given Kenvue’s stronger consensus rating and higher possible upside, analysts plainly believe Kenvue is more favorable than L’Oreal.

Profitability

This table compares L’Oreal and Kenvue’s net margins, return on equity and return on assets.

Valuation and Earnings

This table compares L’Oreal and Kenvue”s gross revenue, earnings per share (EPS) and valuation.

L’Oreal has higher revenue and earnings than Kenvue.

Summary

Kenvue beats L’Oreal on 10 of the 16 factors compared between the two stocks.

About L’Oreal

(Get Free Report)

L'Oréal S.A., through its subsidiaries, manufactures and sells cosmetic products for women and men worldwide. The company operates through four divisions: Consumer Products, L'oréal Luxe, Professional Products, and Dermatological Beauty. It offers skincare, make-up, hair colourants, haircare, perfumes, and hygiene products. The company provides its products under the L'Oréal Paris, Garnier, Maybelline New York, NYX Professional Makeup, Stylenanda, Essie, Dark & Lovely, Mixa, Magic Mask, Niley, Lancôme, Yves Saint Laurent, Armani, Kiehl's Since 1851, Helena Rubinstein, Biotherm, Shu Uemura, IT Cosmetics, Ralph Lauren Fragrance, Urban Decay, Mugler, Valentino, Viktor&Rolf, Azzaro, Prada, Cacharel, Maison Margela Fragrance, Diesel, Yue Sai, Atelier Colonge, Carita, Takami, Aesop, L'Oréal Professionnel Paris, Kérastase, Redken, Matrix, Pureology, Pulp Riot, La Roche-Posay, Vichy, CeraVe, SkinCeuticals, and Skinbetter Science brands. It sells its products through distribution channels, such as hair salons, local stores, e-commerce, travel retail, mass market retail, department store perfumeries, pharmacies, drug stores, medi-spas, and free-standing stores. L'Oréal S.A. was founded in 1909 and is headquartered in Clichy, France.

About Kenvue

(Get Free Report)

Kenvue Inc. operates as a consumer health company worldwide. The company operates through three segments: Self Care, Skin Health and Beauty, and Essential Health. The Self Care segment offers cough, cold and allergy, pain care, digestive health, smoking cessation, eye care, and other products under the Tylenol, Motrin, Benadryl, Nicorette, Zarbee's, ORSLTM, Rhinocort, Calpol, and Zyrtec brands. The Skin Health and Beauty segment provides face and body care, hair, sun, and other care products under the Neutrogena, Aveeno, Dr.Ci:Labo, Le Petit Marseillais, Lubriderm, Rogaine, and OGX brand names. The Essential Health segment offers oral and baby, women's health, wound, and other care products under the Listerine, Johnson's, Band-Aid, and Stayfree, o.b., tampons, Carefree, and Desitin Diaper Rash brands. The company was incorporated in 2022 and is headquartered in Skillman, New Jersey.

name: Colgate-Palmolive
title: Colgate-Palmolive launches up to $300M supply chain revamp - Yahoo Finance
description:
This story was originally published on Supply Chain Dive.
To receive daily news and insights, subscribe to our free daily Supply Chain Dive newsletter.
However, the company’s subsequently leaner supply chain faces different macroeconomic conditions than when Colgate-Palmolive completed the effort at the end of 2024.
Colgate-Palmolive's supply chain has also had to respond quickly to demand changes fueled by consumer uncertainty, Wallace said.
Recommended Reading At Colgate, supply chain and sustainability come from the same tube
text:
This story was originally published on Supply Chain Dive. To receive daily news and insights, subscribe to our free daily Supply Chain Dive newsletter.

Dive Brief:

Colgate-Palmolive plans to optimize its global supply chain as part of a three-year, $200 million to $300 million productivity program, CFO Stanley Sutula told investors on an Aug. 1 earnings call.

The initiative will also include restructuring parts of the personal and home care company's organizational framework and streamlining operations to reduce overhead and increase efficiency, per the company's Q2 earnings statement.

"We're not going to go into detailed specifics here, but as we said, it would be a combination of optimizing our supply chain and then looking at areas where we think that we can optimize where we have our allocation of resources," Sutula said.

Dive Insight:

Colgate-Palmolive, like many manufacturers, is leveraging its supply chain as a source for higher productivity, lower costs and operational efficiency. In June, Procter & Gamble unveiled plans to reorganize its network as part of a two-year restructuring project.

Colgate-Palmolive's latest productivity program comes less than 12 months after it completed a two-year initiative that included streamlining the company's supply chain to reduce structural costs, per the company's latest annual report.

However, the company’s subsequently leaner supply chain faces different macroeconomic conditions than when Colgate-Palmolive completed the effort at the end of 2024.

"Colgate-Palmolive is dealing with volatile and rising costs due to tariff increases, higher raw and packaging material costs and lower category inflation, which leaves less room to raise retail prices in response to rising costs in other parts of the business," CEO Noel Wallace said on the earnings call.

Colgate-Palmolive's supply chain has also had to respond quickly to demand changes fueled by consumer uncertainty, Wallace said. That includes adjusting to consumer preferences when they shift between more expensive product multipacks and less expensive single packs or smaller sizes.

"We can then leverage our global supply chain's breadth, resiliency and agility to respond to these changes in consumer preference," Wallace said.

In releasing its Q2 earnings, Colgate-Palmolive lowered its projected 2025 tariff costs to $75 million from the $200 million stated in its Q1 earnings call. The latest estimate is based on tariffs announced and finalized as of July 31, per an earnings presentation.

This story was first published in our Operations Weekly newsletter. Sign up here.

Recommended Reading

At Colgate, supply chain and sustainability come from the same tube

text:
1. Market Snapshot

Headline Takeaway: Ecolab (ECL) is showing a mixed market picture — fundamentals remain strong, but recent technical signals suggest caution.

The stock currently trades at a 0.63% increase, with a 4.96 internal diagnostic score (0-10) on fundamentals and a 7.7 internal diagnostic score on fund flows, but a 4.17 internal diagnostic score from recent technical indicators signaling a need for caution.

2. News Highlights

Recent news surrounding Ecolab and the broader market includes:

Safex Chemicals Expands Manufacturing Footprint – A major development in crop protection solutions could indirectly benefit Ecolab’s industry. The new facility will add approximately 300 jobs and scale to 80 MT/day production.

U.S. Energy & Chemicals Industry Growth – Deloitte predicts a 4.1% workforce growth by 2033 and highlights the need for upskilling in AI and related technologies — a positive backdrop for Ecolab's long-term business.

U.S. Regulatory Shifts Affecting Exports – New restrictions on chemical shipments to China could disrupt global supply chains and indirectly affect Ecolab’s market dynamics.

These developments highlight a cautiously optimistic industry environment but also potential near-term headwinds.

3. Analyst Views & Fundamentals

Ecolab has received a mixed but generally optimistic set of ratings from analysts:

Simple Average Rating: 4.00 (out of 5)

Historical Performance-Weighted Rating: 5.47

Rating Consistency: Mixed, with one "Strong Buy," one "Buy," and one "Neutral" rating in the past 20 days.

Price Trend Match: Current price is up 0.63%, aligning with a weighted optimistic market expectation.

Key fundamental factor values (with internal diagnostic scores) include:

Net cash flow from operating activities per share (YoY growth rate %): -14.74% — score: 1 (weak)

PE: 148.64 — score: 4 (cautious)

Net cash flow from operating activities (YoY growth rate %): -15.02% — score: 2 (very weak)

Total profit / EBIT (%): 90.59% — score: 2 (cautious)

Cash-UP: 0.65 — score: 3 (moderate)

CFOA: 2.96% — score: 3 (moderate)

Cost of sales ratio (%): 55.48% — score: 1 (weak)

Equity multiplier (DuPont analysis %): 255.14% — score: 3 (moderate)

Current ratio: 144.15% — score: 2 (cautious)

Cash-MV: -53.95% — score: 1 (very weak)

While some fundamentals remain strong, the recent operating cash flow and net profit margins are weak indicators. Investors should monitor upcoming earnings and balance sheet changes.

4. Money-Flow Trends

Big-money flows show a positive overall trend, with large and extra-large institutional flows at 50.79% and 50.15% inflow ratios respectively, indicating confidence from major investors. In contrast, retail flows are negative, with small investors showing a net outflow at 49.79%.

This contrast between institutional and retail sentiment suggests a divergence in market psychology. Big money remains optimistic, but individual investors appear cautious or bearish in the short term.

5. Key Technical Signals

Technical indicators present a mixed and uncertain market. The internal diagnostic score is 4.17 (0-10), with weak technology and a need for caution as the main takeaway. Here's a breakdown of the recent signals:

RSI Overbought: internal diagnostic score: 1 — bearish bias, with a 20% historical win rate.

Marubozu White: internal diagnostic score: 1 — bearish bias, with a 12.5% win rate.

Bearish Engulfing: internal diagnostic score: 7.82 — bullish bias, with a high 71.43% win rate.

WR Overbought: internal diagnostic score: 6.85 — neutral bias.

Recent Chart Patterns by Date:

2025-08-22: WR Overbought

2025-08-21: WR Overbought

2025-08-19: WR Overbought and Marubozu White

2025-08-18: WR Overbought and Bearish Engulfing

2025-08-20: WR Overbought and RSI Overbought

These patterns suggest a highly volatile market with conflicting signals — bearish and bullish — over the past five days. The lack of a clear trend reinforces the need for caution.

6. Conclusion

Ecolab presents a mixed investment outlook. Fundamentally strong, with a solid institutional flow, it is currently facing conflicting technical signals and weak cash flow growth. Investors should consider waiting for a clearer trend to form before entering new positions.

name: Ecolab
title: Ecolab Maintains Market Perform Rating at Raymond James Amid High Valuation Expectations
description:
Ecolab has been resumed with a Market Perform rating by Raymond James, citing favorable business prospects and a high valuation.
The firm finds the current valuation difficult to justify and notes that forward pricing and margin expectations set a high bar for the stock.
Ecolab (ECL) shares have seen a mixed performance recently, with a 3.74% rise but facing uncertain technical signals and mixed analyst ratings.
Analysts have shown divided ratings, with one "Strong Buy," one "Buy," and one "Neutral" rating in the last 20 days.
The average rating score is 4.00, while the performance-weighted score is 5.47.
text:
Ecolab has been resumed with a Market Perform rating by Raymond James, citing favorable business prospects and a high valuation. The firm finds the current valuation difficult to justify and notes that forward pricing and margin expectations set a high bar for the stock.

Ecolab (ECL) shares have seen a mixed performance recently, with a 3.74% rise but facing uncertain technical signals and mixed analyst ratings. The stock's technical analysis score of 4.07 indicates a need for caution, with indicators like the RSI being overbought and bearish engulfing signals present [1].

Analysts have shown divided ratings, with one "Strong Buy," one "Buy," and one "Neutral" rating in the last 20 days. The average rating score is 4.00, while the performance-weighted score is 5.47. Despite the optimistic ratings, fundamentals reveal weak operating growth and a high 148.64 P/E ratio, with net cash flow from operating activities declining by 14.74% year-over-year [1].

Strong institutional and retail inflows, with an inflow ratio of 0.51, suggest market optimism. However, the overall technical picture is volatile, with conflicting signals and no clear direction. The recent expansion of Safex Chemicals in India and growth in Asia-Pacific ETFs could indirectly benefit Ecolab, but broader market risks, such as U.S.-China export restrictions, pose concerns [2].

Ecolab's current market position is precarious, with mixed fundamentals and technical indicators. The best course of action for investors may be to wait for a clearer trend before committing to a directional bet. A pull-back or breakout in the near term could provide a better entry point.
